description:
After a family tragedy turns her life upside down, plucky high schooler Tohru Honda takes matters into her own hands and moves out...into a tent! Unfortunately for her, she pitches her new home on private land belonging to the mysterious Sohma clan, and it isn't long before the owners discover her secret. But, as Tohru quickly finds out when the family offers to take her in, the Sohmas have a secret of their own--when touched by the opposite sex, they turn into the animals of the Chinese Zodiac!

(Source: Yen Press)

Note: Volume 9 includes the bonus chapter "Rain Shelter of Terror".

tags.name: Shoujo
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult females.

tags.name: Animals
tags.description: Prominently features animal characters in a leading role.

tags.name: Mythology
tags.description: Prominently features mythological elements, especially those from religious or cultural tradition.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Philosophy
tags.description: Relating or devoted to the study of the fundamental nature of knowledge, reality, and existence.

tags.name: Shapeshifting
tags.description: Features character(s) who changes one's appearance or form.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Reincarnation
tags.description: Features a character being born again after death, typically as another person or in another world.

tags.name: Rehabilitation
tags.description: Prominently features the recovery of a character who became incapable of social life or work.

tags.name: Primarily Male Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of male characters.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Female Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is female.

tags.name: Found Family
tags.description: Features a group of characters with no biological relations that are united in a group providing social support.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Family Life
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a family unit.

tags.name: Tsundere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who acts cold and hostile in order to mask warmer emotions.

tags.name: Age Gap
tags.description: Prominently features romantic relations between people with a significant age difference.

tags.name: Coming of Age
tags.description: Centers around a character's transition from childhood to adulthood.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: Love Triangle
tags.description: Centered around romantic feelings between more than two people. Includes all love polygons.

tags.name: Memory Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) who has had their memories altered.

tags.name: Disability
tags.description: A work that features one or more characters with a physical, mental, cognitive, or developmental condition that impairs, interferes with, or limits the person's ability to engage in certain tasks or actions.

tags.name: Unrequited Love
tags.description: One or more characters are experiencing an unrequited love that may or may not be reciprocated.

tags.name: Estranged Family
tags.description: At least one family member of the MC intentionally distances themselves or a family distances themselves from a person related to the MC.

tags.name: Youkai
tags.description: Prominently features supernatural creatures from Japanese folklore.

tags.name: Orphan
tags.description: Prominently features a character that is an orphan.

tags.name: Crossdressing
tags.description: Prominently features a character dressing up as the opposite sex.

tags.name: Incest
tags.description: Features sexual or romantic relations between characters who are related by blood.

tags.name: Curses
tags.description: Features a character, object or area that has been cursed, usually by a malevolent supernatural force.

tags.name: Henshin
tags.description: Prominently features character or costume transformations which often grant special abilities.

tags.name: Delinquents
tags.description: Features characters with a notorious image and attitude, sometimes referred to as "yankees".

tags.name: Revenge
tags.description: Prominently features a character who aims to exact punishment in a resentful or vindictive manner.

tags.name: Dissociative Identities
tags.description: A case where one or more people share the same body.

tags.name: Teacher
tags.description: Protagonist is an educator, usually in a school setting.

tags.name: Marriage
tags.description: Centers around marriage between two or more characters.

tags.name: Cohabitation
tags.description: Features two or more people who live in the same household and develop a romantic or sexual relationship.

tags.name: Monster Boy
tags.description: Prominently features a male character who is a part-monster.

tags.name: Transgender
tags.description: Features a character whose gender identity differs from the sex they were assigned at birth.

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/n_takaya77)

Natsuki Takaya is a Japanese manga artist best known for creating the series Fruits Basket.

Takaya was born and raised in Tokyo, where she made her debut as a manga artist in 1992. Takaya is left handed and had wanted to be a manga artist since first grade, when her sister started drawing.

__Awards:__
* 2001: Kodansha Manga Award, Shojo : _Fruits Basket_

[Official website](http://futagotranslations.weebly.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/twintranslators) | [LiveJournal](https://double-dear.livejournal.com/)

Part of the duo Futago Translations with [Athena Nibley](https://anilist.co/staff/225414/).

[Official website](http://futagotranslations.weebly.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/twintranslators) | [LiveJournal](https://double-dear.livejournal.com/)

Part of the duo Futago Translations with [Alethea Nibley](https://anilist.co/staff/214174/).
